title: (Suspected Bug) Issue with unexpected parameter in internal Explanation function call
body:
I get this error in shap version 0.39.0.

It appears there is a function call with an unexpected parameter leading to an error when calling an Explainer (in this case a Tree Explainer) with the "interactions=True" parameter.

It's possible I'm using things incorrectly as there is limited documentation on this at the moment, but it appears to be fairly straightforward and so I believe this may be an oversight in the shap code.



 File "C:\code\ML\lib\shap_lib_new.py", line 186, in get_shap_values
    explainer = shap.explainers.Tree(model)
    shap_values = explainer(data, interactions=True)  # shap_values is now an Explanation object
  File "C:\Program Files\Python38\envs\myenv\lib\site-packages\shap\explainers\_tree.py", line 226, in __call__
    e = Explanation(v, base_values=self.expected_value, data=X, feature_names=feature_names, interaction_order=2)
TypeError: __init__() got an unexpected keyword argument 'interaction_order'


Which is from the second-to-last line in this __call__ function within _tree.py file below, where it looks like there is no "interaction_order" parameter defined:

    def __call__(self, X, y=None, interactions=False, check_additivity=True):

        if safe_isinstance(X, "pandas.core.frame.DataFrame"):
            feature_names = list(X.columns)
            X = X.values
        else:
            feature_names = getattr(self, "data_feature_names", None)

        if not interactions:
            v = self.shap_values(X, y=y, from_call=True, check_additivity=check_additivity)
            output_shape = tuple()
            if type(v) is list:
                output_shape = (len(v),)
                v = np.stack(v, axis=-1) # put outputs at the end

            # the explanation object expects an expected value for each row
            if hasattr(self.expected_value, "__len__"):
                ev_tiled = np.tile(self.expected_value, (v.shape[0],1))
            else:
                ev_tiled = np.tile(self.expected_value, v.shape[0])

            e = Explanation(v, base_values=ev_tiled, data=X, feature_names=feature_names)
        else:
            v = self.shap_interaction_values(X)
            e = Explanation(v, base_values=self.expected_value, data=X, feature_names=feature_names, interaction_order=2)
        return e
